item.title: windows10 WSL setup
item.description:
WSL å®‰è£…ç³»ç»Ÿ

æ¨è Ubuntu-22.04 Ubuntu 22.04 LTS

wsl.exe --install --d Ubuntu-22.04

WSL å¸è½½ç³»ç»Ÿ

wsl -l -v

wsl --unregister Debian

WSL kernel å®¢åˆ¶åŒ–

é¦–å…ˆè¿è¡Œ wsl é€šè¿‡å¦‚ä¸‹å‘½ä»¤ç¡®è®¤å½“å‰å†…æ ¸ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š

uname -a
Linux x 6.6.87.2-microsoft-standard-WSL2+ #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Sun Jun 15 21:13:48 CST 2025 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

å…‹éš†æºä»£ç 

git clone https://github.com/microsoft/WSL2-Linux-Kernel.git --depth=1 -b linux-msft-wsl-6.6.y
cd WSL2-Linux-Kernel
git tag -l | grep "6.6.87"
git checkout -b my-6.6.87.2-kernel linux-msft-wsl-6.6.87.2
  • --depth=1 clones only the latest commit to save time and space.
  • -b linux-msft-wsl-6.6.y specifies the branch to clone.

ç›®å‰ github https://github.com/microsoft/WSL2-Linux-Kernel ä¸»è¦ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š

item.title: windows WSL ç«¯å£æ˜ å°„
item.description:
å®é™…åº”ç”¨ä¸­éœ€è¦å°†åµŒå…¥å¼å¼€å‘æ¿çš„æ•°æ®é€šè¿‡ç½‘ç»œå‘é€å‡ºå»ï¼Œå¦‚æœ WSL ä¸­è¿è¡Œçš„ client è¦ä¸åµŒå…¥å¼å¼€å‘æ¿è¿›è¡Œé€šè®¯ï¼Œåˆ™éœ€è¦å°† windows çš„ç«¯å£è½¬å‘åˆ° WSL ä¸­ï¼Œåä¹‹ï¼Œå¦‚æœé…ç½®äº† windows ç«¯å£è½¬å‘åˆ° WSL ä¸­ï¼Œåˆ™ windows client æ— æ³•æ­£å¸¸æ¥æ”¶å¼€å‘æ¿çš„æ•°æ®ï¼Œè¿™ä¸€ç‚¹éœ€è¦æ³¨æ„ï¼Œéœ€è¦å–æ¶ˆç«¯å£è½¬å‘ windows ç«¯æ‰å¯ä»¥æ­£å¸¸æ¥æ”¶æ•°æ®ã€‚

From: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/networking

Here’s an example of using theÂ Netsh interface portproxyÂ Windows command to add a port proxy that listens on your host port and connects that port proxy to the IP address for the WSL 2 VM.

netsh interface portproxy add v4tov4 listenport=<yourPortToForward> listenaddress=0.0.0.0 connectport=<yourPortToConnectToInWSL> connectaddress=(wsl hostname -I)

In this example, you will need to updateÂ <yourPortToForward>Â to a port number, for exampleÂ listenport=4000.Â listenaddress=0.0.0.0Â means that incoming requests will be accepted from ANY IP address. The Listen Address specifies the IPv4 address for which to listen and can be changed to values that include: IP address, computer NetBIOS name, or computer DNS name. If an address isn’t specified, the default is the local computer. You need to update theÂ <yourPortToConnectToInWSL>Â value to a port number where you want WSL to connect, for exampleÂ connectport=4000. Lastly, theÂ connectaddressÂ value needs to be the IP address of your Linux distribution installed via WSL 2 (the WSL 2 VM address), which can be found by entering the command:Â wsl.exe hostname -I.
